page.title: 05HOLME LACY POST OFFICE
page.content: Holme Lacy Post Office is{very small, with enough space for about five adults. It is built onto the side of the house of the lady who runs it. {Trade is quite good,}even though Holme Lacy is very small. The lady who runs it sells{stamps, sweets, {cigarettes, ice cream and soft drinks, mainly in cans. She used only to sell stamps, but the{old village shop closed in 1975 so now she has the other things. There is an old letter box at the gate to the office. There is a{notice board}for the village, it costs 5 pence to put a notice on it. She sells a lot of pop and sweets, and some cigarettes, to the students at the College of Agriculture. A lot of customers stop for a chat, so all the {news of the village}can be passed on or learned over the counter.
